00037 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00038 #define _GNU_SOURCE /* pull in O_DIRECTORY in bits/fcntl.h */
00039 #endif
00040 #include <errno.h>

00043 #include <stdio.h>
00044 #include <string.h>
00045 #include <sys/types.h>
00046 #include <sys/stat.h>
00047 #include <sys/mman.h>

00053 #include <unistd.h>

00059 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>

00061 #define T1 "write data before unlink\n"
00062 #define T2 "write data after unlink\n"
00063 char msg[] = "yabba dabba doo, I'm coming for you, I live in a shoe, I don't know what to do.\n'Bigger, bigger,and bigger yet!' cried the Creator.  'You are not yet substantial enough for my boundless intents!'  And ever greater and greater the object became, until all was lost 'neath its momentus bulk.\n";
00064 char *buf, *buf_align;
00065 int bufsize = 0;
00066 sem_t sem;
00067 #define ALIGN_LEN 65535
00068 #define XATTR "user.multiop"
00069 
00070 char usage[] =
00071 "Usage: %s filename command-sequence [path...]\n"
00072 "    command-sequence items:\n"
00073 "        A  fsetxattr(\"user.multiop\")\n"
00074 "        a  fgetxattr(\"user.multiop\")\n"
00075 "        c  close\n"
00076 "        B[num] call setstripe ioctl to create stripes\n"
00077 "        C[num] create with optional stripes\n"
00078 "        d  mkdir\n"
00079 "        D  open(O_DIRECTORY)\n"
00080 "        e[R|W|U] apply lease. R: Read; W: Write; U: Unlock\n"
00081 "        E[+|-] get lease. +/-: expect lease to (not) exist\n"
00082 "        f  statfs\n"
00083 "        F  print FID\n"
00084 "        H[num] create HSM released file with num stripes\n"
00085 "        G gid get grouplock\n"
00086 "        g gid put grouplock\n"
00087 "        K  link path to filename\n"
00088 "        L  link\n"
00089 "        l  symlink filename to path\n"
00090 "        m  mknod\n"
00091 "        M  rw mmap to EOF (must open and stat prior)\n"
00092 "        n  rename path to filename\n"
00093 "        N  rename filename to path\n"
00094 "        o  open(O_RDONLY)\n"
00095 "        O  open(O_CREAT|O_RDWR)\n"
00096 "        r[num] read [optional length]\n"
00097 "        R  reference entire mmap-ed region\n"
00098 "        s  stat\n"
00099 "        S  fstat\n"
00100 "        t  fchmod\n"
00101 "        T[num] ftruncate [optional position, default 0]\n"
00102 "        u  unlink\n"
00103 "        U  munmap\n"
00104 "        v  verbose\n"
00105 "        V  open a volatile file\n"
00106 "        w[num] write optional length\n"
00107 "        x  get file data version\n"
00108 "        W  write entire mmap-ed region\n"
00109 "        y  fsync\n"
00110 "        Y  fdatasync\n"
00111 "        z[num] seek [optional position, default 0]\n"
00112 "        _  wait for signal\n";
00113 
00114 void usr1_handler(int unused)
00115 {
00116         int saved_errno = errno;
00117 
00118         /*
00119          * signal(7): POSIX.1-2004 ...requires an implementation to guarantee
00120          * that the following functions can be safely called inside a signal
00121          * handler:
00122          *            sem_post()
00123          */
00124         sem_post(&sem);
00125 
00126         errno = saved_errno;
00127 }
00128 
00129 static const char *
00130 pop_arg(int argc, char *argv[])
00131 {
00132         static int cur_arg = 3;
00133 
00134         if (cur_arg >= argc)
00135                 return NULL;
00136 
00137         return argv[cur_arg++];
00138 }
00139 
00140 struct flag_mapping {
00141         const char *string;
00142         const int  flag;
00143 } flag_table[] = {
00144         {"O_RDONLY", O_RDONLY},
00145         {"O_WRONLY", O_WRONLY},
00146         {"O_RDWR", O_RDWR},
00147         {"O_CREAT", O_CREAT},
00148         {"O_EXCL", O_EXCL},
00149         {"O_NOCTTY", O_NOCTTY},
00150         {"O_TRUNC", O_TRUNC},
00151         {"O_APPEND", O_APPEND},
00152         {"O_NONBLOCK", O_NONBLOCK},
00153         {"O_NDELAY", O_NDELAY},
00154         {"O_SYNC", O_SYNC},
00155 #ifdef O_DIRECT
00156         {"O_DIRECT", O_DIRECT},
00157 #endif
00158 #ifdef O_NOATIME
00159         {"O_NOATIME", O_NOATIME},
00160 #endif
00161         {"O_LARGEFILE", O_LARGEFILE},
00162         {"O_DIRECTORY", O_DIRECTORY},
00163         {"O_NOFOLLOW", O_NOFOLLOW},
00164         {"O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE", O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE},
00165         {"", -1}
00166 };
00167 
00168 int get_flags(char *data, int *rflags)
00169 {
00170         char *cloned_flags;
00171         char *tmp;
00172         int flag_set = 0;
00173         int flags = 0;
00174         int size = 0;
00175 
00176         cloned_flags = strdup(data);
00177         if (cloned_flags == NULL) {
00178                 fprintf(stderr, "Insufficient memory.\n");
00179                 exit(-1);
00180         }
00181 
00182         for (tmp = strtok(cloned_flags, ":"); tmp;
00183              tmp = strtok(NULL, ":")) {
00184                 int i;
00185 
00186                 size = tmp - cloned_flags;
00187                 for (i = 0; flag_table[i].flag != -1; i++) {
00188                         if (!strcmp(tmp, flag_table[i].string)){
00189                                 flags |= flag_table[i].flag;
00190                                 size += strlen(flag_table[i].string);
00191                                 flag_set = 1;
00192                                 break;
00193                         }
00194                 }
00195         }
00196         free(cloned_flags);
00197 
00198         if (!flag_set) {
00199                 *rflags = O_RDONLY;
00200                 return 0;
00201         }
00202 
00203         *rflags = flags;
00204         return size;
00205 }
00206 
00207 #define POP_ARG() (pop_arg(argc, argv))
00208 
00209 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00210 {
00211         char                    *fname, *commands;
00212         const char              *newfile;
00213         const char              *oldpath;
00214         struct stat              st;
00215         struct statfs            stfs;
00216         size_t                   mmap_len = 0, i;
00217         unsigned char           *mmap_ptr = NULL, junk = 0;
00218         int                      rc, len, fd = -1;
00219         int                      flags;
00220         int                      save_errno;
00221         int                      verbose = 0;
00222         int                      gid = 0;
00223         lustre_fid               fid;
00224         struct timespec          ts;
00225         struct lov_user_md_v3    lum;
00226         __u64                    dv;
00227 
00228         if (argc < 3) {
00229                 fprintf(stderr, usage, argv[0]);
00230                 exit(1);
00231         }
00232 
00233         memset(&st, 0, sizeof(st));
00234         sem_init(&sem, 0, 0);
00235         /* use sigaction instead of signal to avoid SA_ONESHOT semantics */
00236         sigaction(SIGUSR1, &(const struct sigaction){.sa_handler = &usr1_handler},
00237                   NULL);
00238 
00239         fname = argv[1];
00240 
00241         for (commands = argv[2]; *commands; commands++) {
00242                 switch (*commands) {
00243                 case '_':
00244                         if (verbose) {
00245                                 printf("PAUSING\n");
00246                                 fflush(stdout);
00247                         }
00248                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00249                         if (len <= 0)
00250                                 len = 3600; /* 1 hour */
00251                         ts.tv_sec = time(NULL) + len;
00252                         ts.tv_nsec = 0;
00253                         while (sem_timedwait(&sem, &ts) < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00254                         break;
00255                 case 'A':
00256                         if (fsetxattr(fd, XATTR, "multiop", 8, 0)) {
00257                                 save_errno = errno;
00258                                 perror("fsetxattr");
00259                                 exit(save_errno);
00260                         }
00261                         break;
00262                 case 'a':
00263                         if (fgetxattr(fd, XATTR, NULL, 0) == -1) {
00264                                 save_errno = errno;
00265                                 perror("fgetxattr");
00266                                 exit(save_errno);
00267                         }
00268                         break;
00269                 case 'c':
00270                         if (close(fd) == -1) {
00271                                 save_errno = errno;
00272                                 perror("close");
00273                                 exit(save_errno);
00274                         }
00275                         fd = -1;
00276                         break;
00277                 case 'B':
00278                         lum = (struct lov_user_md_v3) {
00279                                 .lmm_magic = LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3,
00280                                 .lmm_stripe_count = atoi(commands + 1),
00281                         };
00282 
00283                         if (ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LOV_SETSTRIPE, &lum) < 0) {
00284                                 save_errno = errno;
00285                                 perror("LL_IOC_LOV_SETSTRIPE");
00286                                 exit(save_errno);
00287                         }
00288                         break;
00289                 case 'C':
00290                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00291                         fd = llapi_file_open(fname, O_CREAT | O_WRONLY, 0644,
00292                                              0, 0, len, 0);
00293                         if (fd == -1) {
00294                                 save_errno = errno;
00295                                 perror("create stripe file");
00296                                 exit(save_errno);
00297                         }
00298                         break;
00299                 case 'd':
00300                         if (mkdir(fname, 0755) == -1) {
00301                                 save_errno = errno;
00302                                 perror("mkdir(0755)");
00303                                 exit(save_errno);
00304                         }
00305                         break;
00306                 case 'D':
00307                         fd = open(fname, O_DIRECTORY);
00308                         if (fd == -1) {
00309                                 save_errno = errno;
00310                                 perror("open(O_DIRECTORY)");
00311                                 exit(save_errno);
00312                         }
00313                         break;
00314                 case 'e':
00315                         commands++;
00316                         switch (*commands) {
00317                         case 'U':
00318                                 flags = LL_LEASE_UNLCK;
00319                                 break;
00320                         case 'R':
00321                                 flags = LL_LEASE_RDLCK;
00322                                 break;
00323                         case 'W':
00324                                 flags = LL_LEASE_WRLCK;
00325                                 break;
00326                         default:
00327                                 errx(-1, "unknown mode: %c", *commands);
00328                         }
00329 
00330                         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_SET_LEASE, flags);
00331                         if (rc < 0)
00332                                 err(errno, "apply lease error");
00333 
00334                         if (flags != LL_LEASE_UNLCK)
00335                                 break;
00336 
00337                         /* F_UNLCK, interpret return code */
00338                         if (rc > 0) {
00339                                 const char *str = "unknown";
00340                                 if (rc == LL_LEASE_RDLCK)
00341                                         str = "read";
00342                                 else if (rc == LL_LEASE_WRLCK)
00343                                         str = "write";
00344                                 fprintf(stdout, "%s lease(%d) released.\n",
00345                                         str, rc);
00346                         } else if (rc == 0) {
00347                                 fprintf(stdout, "lease already broken.\n");
00348                         }
00349                         break;
00350                 case 'E':
00351                         commands++;
00352                         if (*commands != '-' && *commands != '+')
00353                                 errx(-1, "unknown mode: %c\n", *commands);
00354 
00355                         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GET_LEASE);
00356                         if (rc > 0) {
00357                                 const char *str = "unknown";
00358 
00359                                 if (rc == LL_LEASE_RDLCK)
00360                                         str = "read";
00361                                 else if (rc == LL_LEASE_WRLCK)
00362                                         str = "write";
00363                                 fprintf(stdout, "%s lease(%d) has applied.\n",
00364                                         str, rc);
00365                                 if (*commands == '-')
00366                                         errx(-1, "expect lease to not exist");
00367                         } else if (rc == 0) {
00368                                 fprintf(stdout, "no lease applied.\n");
00369                                 if (*commands == '+')
00370                                         errx(-1, "expect lease exists");
00371                         } else {
00372                                 err(errno, "free lease error");
00373                         }
00374                         break;
00375                 case 'f':
00376                         if (statfs(fname, &stfs) == -1)
00377                                 errx(-1, "statfs()");
00378                         break;
00379                 case 'F':
00380                         if (fd == -1)
00381                                 rc = llapi_path2fid(fname, &fid);
00382                         else
00383                                 rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, &fid);
00384                         if (rc != 0)
00385                                 fprintf(stderr,
00386                                         "llapi_path/fd2fid() on %d, rc=%d\n",
00387                                         fd, rc);
00388                         else
00389                                 printf(DFID"\n", PFID(&fid));
00390                         break;
00391                 case 'G':
00392                         gid = atoi(commands+1);
00393                         if (ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_LOCK, gid) == -1) {
00394                                 save_errno = errno;
00395                                 perror("ioctl(GROUP_LOCK)");
00396                                 exit(save_errno);
00397                         }
00398                         break;
00399                 case 'g':
00400                         gid = atoi(commands+1);
00401                         if (ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GROUP_UNLOCK, gid) == -1) {
00402                                 save_errno = errno;
00403                                 perror("ioctl(GROUP_UNLOCK)");
00404                                 exit(save_errno);
00405                         }
00406                         break;
00407                 case 'H':
00408                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00409                         fd = llapi_file_open(fname, O_CREAT | O_WRONLY,
00410                                 0644, 0, 0, len,
00411                                 LOV_PATTERN_RAID0 | LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED);
00412                         if (fd == -1) {
00413                                 save_errno = errno;
00414                                 perror("create stripe file");
00415                                 exit(save_errno);
00416                         }
00417                         break;
00418                 case 'K':
00419                         oldpath = POP_ARG();
00420                         if (oldpath == NULL)
00421                                 oldpath = fname;
00422 
00423                         if (link(oldpath, fname)) {
00424                                 save_errno = errno;
00425                                 perror("link()");
00426                                 exit(save_errno);
00427                         }
00428                         break;
00429                 case 'l':
00430                         newfile = POP_ARG();
00431                         if (!newfile)
00432                                 newfile = fname;
00433                         if (symlink(fname, newfile)) {
00434                                 save_errno = errno;
00435                                 perror("symlink()");
00436                                 exit(save_errno);
00437                         }
00438                         break;
00439                 case 'L':
00440                         newfile = POP_ARG();
00441                         if (newfile == NULL)
00442                                 newfile = fname;
00443 
00444                         if (link(fname, newfile)) {
00445                                 save_errno = errno;
00446                                 perror("link()");
00447                                 exit(save_errno);
00448                         }
00449                         break;
00450                 case 'm':
00451                         if (mknod(fname, S_IFREG | 0644, 0) == -1) {
00452                                 save_errno = errno;
00453                                 perror("mknod(S_IFREG|0644, 0)");
00454                                 exit(save_errno);
00455                         }
00456                         break;
00457                 case 'M':
00458                         if (st.st_size == 0) {
00459                                 fprintf(stderr, "mmap without preceeding stat, or on"
00460                                         " zero length file.\n");
00461                                 exit(-1);
00462                         }
00463                         mmap_len = st.st_size;
00464                         mmap_ptr = mmap(NULL, mmap_len, PROT_WRITE | PROT_READ,
00465                                         MAP_SHARED, fd, 0);
00466                         if (mmap_ptr == MAP_FAILED) {
00467                                 save_errno = errno;
00468                                 perror("mmap");
00469                                 exit(save_errno);
00470                         }
00471                         break;
00472                 case 'n':
00473                         oldpath = POP_ARG();
00474                         if (oldpath == NULL)
00475                                 oldpath = fname;
00476 
00477                         if (rename(oldpath, fname) < 0) {
00478                                 save_errno = errno;
00479                                 perror("rename()");
00480                                 exit(save_errno);
00481                         }
00482                         break;
00483                 case 'N':
00484                         newfile = POP_ARG();
00485                         if (!newfile)
00486                                 newfile = fname;
00487                         if (rename (fname, newfile)) {
00488                                 save_errno = errno;
00489                                 perror("rename()");
00490                                 exit(save_errno);
00491                         }
00492                         break;
00493                 case 'O':
00494                         fd = open(fname, O_CREAT|O_RDWR, 0644);
00495                         if (fd == -1) {
00496                                 save_errno = errno;
00497                                 perror("open(O_RDWR|O_CREAT)");
00498                                 exit(save_errno);
00499                         }
00500                         break;
00501                 case 'o':
00502                         len = get_flags(commands+1, &flags);
00503                         commands += len;
00504                         if (flags & O_CREAT)
00505                                 fd = open(fname, flags, 0666);
00506                         else
00507                                 fd = open(fname, flags);
00508                         if (fd == -1) {
00509                                 save_errno = errno;
00510                                 perror("open");
00511                                 exit(save_errno);
00512                         }
00513                         break;
00514                 case 'r':
00515                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00516                         if (len <= 0)
00517                                 len = 1;
00518                         if (bufsize < len) {
00519                                 void *tmp;
00520                                 tmp = realloc(buf, len + ALIGN_LEN);
00521                                 if (tmp == NULL) {
00522                                         free(buf);
00523                                         save_errno = errno;
00524                                         perror("allocating buf for read\n");
00525                                         exit(save_errno);
00526                                 }
00527                                 buf = tmp;
00528                                 bufsize = len;
00529                                 buf_align = (char *)((long)(buf + ALIGN_LEN) &
00530                                                      ~ALIGN_LEN);
00531                         }
00532                         while (len > 0) {
00533                                 rc = read(fd, buf_align, len);
00534                                 if (rc == -1) {
00535                                         save_errno = errno;
00536                                         perror("read");
00537                                         exit(save_errno);
00538                                 }
00539                                 if (rc < len) {
00540                                         fprintf(stderr, "short read: %u/%u\n",
00541                                                 rc, len);
00542                                         if (rc == 0)
00543                                                 exit(ENODATA);
00544                                 }
00545                                 len -= rc;
00546                                 if (verbose >= 2)
00547                                         printf("%.*s\n", rc, buf_align);
00548                         }
00549                         break;
00550                 case 'R':
00551                         for (i = 0; i < mmap_len && mmap_ptr; i += 4096)
00552                                 junk += mmap_ptr[i];
00553                         break;
00554                 case 's':
00555                         if (stat(fname, &st) == -1) {
00556                                 save_errno = errno;
00557                                 perror("stat");
00558                                 exit(save_errno);
00559                         }
00560                         break;
00561                 case 'S':
00562                         if (fstat(fd, &st) == -1) {
00563                                 save_errno = errno;
00564                                 perror("fstat");
00565                                 exit(save_errno);
00566                         }
00567                         break;
00568                 case 't':
00569                         if (fchmod(fd, 0) == -1) {
00570                                 save_errno = errno;
00571                                 perror("fchmod");
00572                                 exit(save_errno);
00573                         }
00574                         break;
00575                 case 'T':
00576                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00577                         if (ftruncate(fd, len) == -1) {
00578                                 save_errno = errno;
00579                                 printf("ftruncate (%d,%d)\n", fd, len);
00580                                 perror("ftruncate");
00581                                 exit(save_errno);
00582                         }
00583                         break;
00584                 case 'u':
00585                         if (unlink(fname) == -1) {
00586                                 save_errno = errno;
00587                                 perror("unlink");
00588                                 exit(save_errno);
00589                         }
00590                         break;
00591                 case 'U':
00592                         if (munmap(mmap_ptr, mmap_len)) {
00593                                 save_errno = errno;
00594                                 perror("munmap");
00595                                 exit(save_errno);
00596                         }
00597                         break;
00598                 case 'v':
00599                         verbose++;
00600                         break;
00601                 case 'V':
00602                         len = get_flags(commands + 1, &flags);
00603                         commands += len;
00604                         fd = llapi_create_volatile(fname, flags);
00605                         if (fd < 0) {
00606                                 perror("llapi_create_volatile");
00607                                 exit(fd);
00608                         }
00609                         break;
00610                 case 'w':
00611                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00612                         if (len <= 0)
00613                                 len = 1;
00614                         if (bufsize < len) {
00615                                 void *tmp;
00616                                 tmp = realloc(buf, len + ALIGN_LEN);
00617                                 if (tmp == NULL) {
00618                                         free(buf);
00619                                         save_errno = errno;
00620                                         perror("allocating buf for write\n");
00621                                         exit(save_errno);
00622                                 }
00623                                 buf = tmp;
00624                                 bufsize = len;
00625                                 buf_align = (char *)((long)(buf + ALIGN_LEN) &
00626                                                      ~ALIGN_LEN);
00627                                 strncpy(buf_align, msg, bufsize);
00628                         }
00629                         while (len > 0) {
00630                                 rc = write(fd, buf_align, len);
00631                                 if (rc == -1) {
00632                                         save_errno = errno;
00633                                         perror("write");
00634                                         exit(save_errno);
00635                                 }
00636                                 if (rc < len)
00637                                         fprintf(stderr, "short write: %u/%u\n",
00638                                                 rc, len);
00639                                 len -= rc;
00640                         }
00641                         break;
00642                 case 'W':
00643                         for (i = 0; i < mmap_len && mmap_ptr; i += 4096)
00644                                 mmap_ptr[i] += junk++;
00645                         break;
00646                 case 'x':
00647                         rc = llapi_get_data_version(fd, &dv, 0);
00648                         if (rc) {
00649                                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot get file data version"
00650                                         " %d\n", rc);
00651                                 exit(-rc);
00652                         }
00653                         printf("dataversion is %ju\n", (uintmax_t)dv);
00654                         break;
00655                 case 'y':
00656                         if (fsync(fd) == -1) {
00657                                 save_errno = errno;
00658                                 perror("fsync");
00659                                 exit(save_errno);
00660                         }
00661                         break;
00662                 case 'Y':
00663                         if (fdatasync(fd) == -1) {
00664                                 save_errno = errno;
00665                                 perror("fdatasync");
00666                                 exit(save_errno);
00667                         }
00668                         break;
00669                 case 'z':
00670                         len = atoi(commands+1);
00671                         if (lseek(fd, len, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
00672                                 save_errno = errno;
00673                                 perror("lseek");
00674                                 exit(save_errno);
00675                         }
00676                         break;
00677                 case '-':
00678                 case '0':
00679                 case '1':
00680                 case '2':
00681                 case '3':
00682                 case '4':
00683                 case '5':
00684                 case '6':
00685                 case '7':
00686                 case '8':
00687                 case '9':
00688                         break;
00689                 default:
00690                         fprintf(stderr, "unknown command \"%c\"\n", *commands);
00691                         fprintf(stderr, usage, argv[0]);
00692                         exit(1);
00693                 }
00694         }
00695 
00696         if (buf)
00697                 free(buf);
00698 
00699         return 0;
00700 }
